column4: hi guys. I need some assistance with a partition copy, please. I want to migrate an OS on a 4G SD card to a new 8G SD.
I partitioned the new disk ext4, set the boot flag  & then tried both (X being the source, Y being the target) `dd if=/dev/sdX1 of=/dev/sdY1`& `rsync -av /mount/source /mount/target`.
In both cases I completed the copied, but the systems fails to boot (would've expected the dd to work OK). What did I miss?
mbr
dd if=/dev/sdX of=/dev/=sdY count=1 bs=445
thanks. that copies it along withthe MBR?
dd if=/dev/sdX of=/dev/=sdY count=1 bs=447
that only copies the MBR
it leaves the partition table alone.  It is only copiying the first 447 bytes
actually let me double check the number, I do this once or twice a year, and I always end up looking it up
assume do that *before* copying the rest of the partition?
thanks. appreciated
it could be done after
ha, I am 0 for 2, the byte count is 446
you could always use dd or ddrescue to copy the first disk to the second and then resize the partition on the second to maximize the used space

you may see people reference 512 byte count if you search with google, that will copy the partition table as well and will break the existing partition table (since the disk geometiries are different)

just to reiterate, I make use of `dd if=/dev/sdX of=/dev/=sdY count=1 bs=446` to copy the MBR & then juat a regular dd to copy the rest of the contents, or do I simply make use of ddrescue to do the whole thing?
basically, since you already copied the partitions, you just need to do "dd if=/dev/sdX of=/dev/=sdY count=1 bs=446"
actually, I just reformatted the partition before hopping on IRC
alternatively, just use ddrescue to copy the whole thing, and then use parted or gparted to resize the partition
sweet, thanks
NP
